text:
when trying to build a new apache release from sourve i get this error:

Configuring Apache Portable Runtime Utility library...

checking for APR-util... yes
configure: error: Cannot use an external APR-util with the bundled APR
make: *** [apache] Error 1
creator: david@ols.es
jorton@redhat.com
text:
You can pass --with-included-apr to configure to work around this. (it shouldn't
happen though)

creator: david@ols.es
text: already tried this but makes no difference

From a freshly unpacked source tarball please run:

$ ./configure [any arguments you pass] > output

and then attach the "output" file, and the "config.log" which is produced using
the bugzilla attachment feature.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
Hi !!

It just happens to work now, thanx a lot
creator: david@ols.es

text:
I can confirm that this happens for me too on CentOS release 4.4 (Final). Adding
the --with-included-apr fixes the problem.
creator: packagethief@gmail.com

text:
Also same issue here, but why is this bug marked "invalid"? Can someone explain
why, if a work-around is required, the bug has been marked as invalid?
creator: work@kyelewis.info

text:
It shouldn't have been marked INVALID really, but never mind.  Fix merged for
1.2.9: http://svn.apache.org/viewvc?view=rev&revision=533027
creator: jorton@redhat.com
